**Chapter Four: The Yellow Court**

The Yellow Court’s inner maiden wears brocade robes—
The Yellow Court’s inner maiden refers to the Dao Mother;
The Yellow Court’s perfected one refers to the Dao Father,
both embodied within the self.
The brocade robes bear the five colors,
signifying the true qi of the five viscera.
Within the Three Courts, they are fully present.

Purple auroras trail her skirts like drifting clouds—
The *Scripture of the Ten Directions* states:
The Most High Jade Emperor wears a robe of luminous, cloud-woven skirts,
the raiment of immortals.

Cinnabar and azure, green branches with jade-like boughs,
where the five-colored essences intertwine to form the immortal’s garb.
The seven-tiered jade lock seals the double doors—
an outer metaphor.
The seven apertures open and close like bolts,
used with the Dao, never sealed in vain.
The lock is adorned with its key.
To store the spirit, cross the hands and close the eyes—
thus sealing the two doors.

Double-shuttered, the golden gate guards the secret mechanism—
"Golden" denotes firmness and strength.
The *Scripture of Laozi* says:
"One skilled in closure needs no bolt yet cannot be opened,"
speaking of the adept who guards the spirit and never leaks it wantonly.

The dark spring flows deep within the towering, secluded gate—
The dark spring is the fluid within the mouth,
also called Jade Brew, Jade Liquid, or Jade Spring.
The space between the eyes is the Gate Court;
the space between the kidneys is the Secluded Gate,
like the twin pillars of a gate’s frame,
with the Dao at its center.
The kidneys lie within, hence called the Secluded Gate.
Though the kidneys rest below the five viscera,
when the form is subdued and the spirit stored,
they rise above the Cinnabar Field—
thus called "towering."

Within the Three Fields, the essence and qi are subtle—
an internal allusion.
In the Cinnabar Field, the spirit and qi transform,
responding to the heart’s intent,
neither existing nor non-existing,
beyond all doing.
Like a dragon entering mystery, its foundation is orderly,
so with qi, the heart governs.
Thus, the image is established—
utter stillness, utter subtlety,
beyond reckoning.
The *Scripture of the Dao’s Mechanism* states:
"Heaven has its Three Lights: sun, moon, and stars;
humans have their Three Treasures: the Three Cinnabar Fields."
In the Cinnabar Field’s qi,
left is blue, right is yellow,
above is white, below is black.

The graceful maiden, lithe and veiled in celestial radiance—
The *True Records* say:
The graceful maiden is the name of the ear’s spirit.
When the ear hears clearly, its brightness veils the dark glow.

The layered hall shines resplendent, displaying the Eight Might—
The layered hall is the name of the throat,
also called the layered tower or layered rings.
This scripture states:
"The Crimson Palace’s layered tower has twelve tiers."
The Crimson Palace is the heart.
The throat lies above the heart, hence called the layered hall.
The throat is the path of fluids,
flowing to nourish the whole body,
illuminating the eight directions.
The spirits of the eight directions are called the Eight Might.

The Heavenly Court and Earthly Gate stand newly arrayed like axes—
The space between the brows is the Heavenly Court.
The incantation of Lady Ziwei says:
"Open the Heavenly Court to grant me longevity."
"Newly arrayed like axes" speaks of vigor and strength.

The Spirit Terrace stands firm, never decaying—
The heart is the Spirit Terrace,
where the divine spirit resides.
In stillness, guard the One;
in movement, store the spirit.
When the spirit is complete and settled,
it never declines.

**Chapter Five: The Central Pool**

The Central Pool’s inner spirit wears crimson pearls—
The gallbladder is the Central Pool;
the tongue is the Flower Pool;
the lower abdomen is the Jade Pool—
all names for the Three Pools.
The *Chapter on the Gallbladder* states:
"The dragon banner spans the sky, casting fire bells."
The crimson pearls refer to the fire bells.

Cinnabar brocade and cloud-woven robes bear the tiger tally—
The cinnabar brocade and cloud-woven robes
are the colors of the heart and lungs,
situated above the gallbladder,
hence called cloud-woven robes and tiger tally.
The *Scripture of the Nine Perfected* says:
"The Yellow Elder Lord’s raiment bears
the dark dragon and divine tiger tally,
girded with flowing golden bells—
the attire of the Dao Lord."

The three-inch ford is where the numinous dwells—
an internal allusion.

The navel lies above the womb, hence called the "horizontal ford." Three inches below the navel is the Cinnabar Field, where the Perfected and the Red Child reside. Concealed within, misty and dense, they support one another—
This refers to the forms of man and woman. Their hidden union is the natural Dao.
According to the *Record of Inner and Outer Divine Mushrooms*:
"The fluids of the five viscera become mushrooms." This is the "hidden mushroom," also called the "inner mushroom."

**Heavenly Pillar Chapter VI**
Tend the essence of the Heavenly Pillar with care—
The Heavenly Pillar is the nose, also called the Heavenly Terrace. The *Scripture of Dissolution and Rubbing* states: "Frequently press the sides of the nose to balance the qi, which is called irrigating the Central Peak and inscribing the Emperor’s Register."
Once the numinous dwelling is purified, the Jade Emperor roams—
The face is the numinous dwelling, also called the Heavenly Abode. It is where the brows, eyes, and mouth reside, hence called the abode. Refine it to perfection, and the immortals will wander there. The *Great Cavern Scripture* says: "The face is the foot-square abode," or sometimes called the "crimson marsh."
Keep the pathways unobstructed without cease—
The *Scripture of Great Simplicity and Cinnabar Radiance* states: "On the face, constantly rub with both hands, following its contours without pause, to unblock the qi and vessels of the ears, eyes, and mouth."
The brows are named the Floral Canopy, shading the bright pearls—
The bright pearls are the eyes.
The Nine Darks and sun-moon illumine the hollow origin—
The *Five Spirits’ Conduct* states: "Above the brows, trace the purple palace of the Hall of Light, with the sun on the left and the moon on the right." The *Jade Calendar Scripture* also says: "Above the Great Clarity are nine-tiered canopies of five-colored blossoms; the human body has them too. One should visualize the pupils as bright as the sun and moon."
Within the abode dwells the Perfected, ever clad in cinnabar—
The True Dragon, spirit of the heart, is the Crimson-Walled Youth, also called the True One, the Red Child, the Child Cinnabar, or the Perfected. Visualizing him keeps him ever present, responding to the heart and reflecting its qi and color.
If one can truly see him, no illness will arise—
Master Primal Yang said: "Constantly visualize the heart’s spirit, and there will be no sickness."
Crimson pearls and numinous skirts, radiant and splendid—
The attire and colors of the heart’s spirit, an external metaphor.
Beneath the tongue, the Dark Gullet is the shore of life and death—
An internal allusion. The Dark Gullet is the shore where fluids and essence flow. The *Root Scripture* states: "The Dark Gullet is the qi vessel that receives the essence tally."
Exhaling clarity and inhaling mystery, the two qi shine—
This refers to the exhalation and inhalation of yin and yang qi, resplendent and luminous.
If you encounter this, you will ascend to the Celestial Han.

**Supreme Dao Chapter VII**
The Supreme Dao is not burdensome; concentrate to preserve the true—
Devotion brings attainment.
The Mud Pill and every joint have their spirits—
Spirits are the wonders of the myriad things, named according to their forms.
Hair and gray blossoms are called Great Primal—
White and black together are called gray, residing at the very top, hence the Great Primal.
The spirit of the brain’s essence-root is called Mud Pill—
The palace of the Cinnabar Field, the union of the Yellow Court, the master of the Grotto Chamber, the root of yin and yang—this is the image of the brain’s Mud Pill.
The spirit of the eyes’ clarity is called Radiant Mystery—
The eyes are likened to the sun and moon, atop the head, hence "clarity above." Radiant Mystery is the pure color of the youthful spirit. An internal allusion.
The spirit of the nose’s jade ridge is called Numinous Firmness—
The ridge’s bone resembles jade, and the spirit’s qi connects to heaven, entering and exiting without exhaustion, hence Numinous Firmness.
The spirit of the ears’ emptiness is called Secluded Field—
Emptiness and seclusion, where hearing is acute and the spirit resides, hence the Secluded Field.
The spirit of the tongue’s life-channel is called Proper Order—
Swallowing fluids with the tongue, life’s essence flows unimpeded. Regulating the five flavors, each has its proper principle.
The spirit of the teeth’s blade-peaks is called Net-Thousand—
The teeth are firm and sharp, like blades that cut and crush, netting all things for consumption.
The spirit of the face governs the Mud Pill—
The brain’s spirit is the master of the hundred spirits of the Cinnabar Field.
The Nine Perfected of the Mud Pill each have their chambers—
The *Great Cavern Scripture* states: "The Three Primes conceal transformations to form the Three Palaces; three times three makes nine, hence the Three Cinnabar Fields." There are also the Three Caverns and the Fish Union, totaling one or two Primes to make the Nine Palaces, where the Nine Perfected spirits reside. Three nines are twenty-seven spirits; when harmonized with a person, they should be visualized—these are also called the Nine August Ones. The Nine Souls transform into nine qi, becoming nine spirits, each dwelling in a grotto chamber.
The chambers are one inch square, situated within—
Each chamber is one inch, and the brain has nine lobes.
Together they wear purple robes and flying gauze skirts—
The attire of the Nine Perfected mirrors the colors of qi, light as flight.
Simply contemplate one division, and longevity will be endless—
Visualizing the Nine Perfected is the way to immortality.
They do not each reside separately within the brain—
The spirits gather in the Cinnabar Field, where the Spring Spirit dwells.
Their seats are arrayed facing outward—
The spirits govern the Cinnabar Field but face outward to ward off misfortune. The *Eight Simplicities Scripture* states: "The Perfected have nine ranks, facing outward in their positions: the Supreme Perfected face upward, the High Perfected south, the Great Perfected east, the Spirit Perfected west, the Mysterious Perfected north, the Immortal Perfected northeast, the Celestial Perfected southeast, the Void Perfected southwest, and the Utmost Perfected northwest." The Celestial Perfected see without looking, hear without listening, rectify without speaking, and follow without moving.
Their existence depends on the heart’s proper alignment—
When the heart contemplates the Mysterious Perfected, inner and outer respond.

**Heart Spirit Chapter VIII**
The spirit of the heart, Cinnabar Prime, is called Guarding Numinous—
An internal metaphor. The heart is the primal organ of the viscera, the color of southern fire, the abode of the spirit’s handle, hence Guarding Numinous.
The spirit of the lungs, Luminous Florescence, is called Empty Accomplishment—
The lungs are the heart’s floral canopy, luminous white, the color of western metal. The lungs’ color is white, their substance light and empty, hence Empty Accomplishment.
The spirit of the liver, Dragon Mist, is called Containing Clarity—
The liver’s position is the phase of wood, the color of the eastern Azure Dragon. Among the viscera, it governs the eyes. The sun rises in the east, hence Containing Clarity.

The misty canopy governs clarity and turbidity—
*Yiyu* is the image of wood; when it meets fire, smoke arises; when it meets yang, qi becomes clear. Clarity brings brightness to the eyes; turbidity brings dimness.

The spirit of the kidneys, Profound Darkness, is called Nurturing Infant—
The kidneys belong to water, hence *Profound Darkness*. Kidney essence generates the child, hence *Nurturing Infant*.

The spirit of the spleen, Ever-Present, is called Soul-Resting—
The spleen occupies the central earth phase, hence *Ever-Present*, the Yellow Court’s palace. The spleen’s grinding digests food, its spirit-power mirrors strength, hence *Soul-Resting*.

The spirit of the gallbladder, Dragon Radiance, is called Majestic Clarity—
The gallbladder’s color is azure light, hence *Dragon Radiance*; it governs courage and vigor, hence *Majestic Clarity*. Externally, it draws from the eastern Azure Dragon’s thunderous resonance.

The six bowels and five viscera embody the spirits’ essence—
They sustain the entire body; none may be discarded, hence *the spirits’ essence*. The heart, liver, spleen, lungs, and kidneys are the five viscera; the stomach, large intestine, small intestine, bladder, triple burner, and gallbladder are the six bowels. The term *bowel* resembles a prefecture’s storehouse, taking the meaning of receiving things, hence *bowel*. The *viscera* each possess a distinct substance yet are collectively stored within the body, hence *viscera*. Much has been said of the triple burner, yet its true nature remains obscure—it lies above the heart, liver, and lungs, within the connecting vessels. The *Central Yellow Scripture* states: “The heart, liver, and lungs are the triple burner,” pointing to its location.

Yet according to the five phases’ colors, the spleen governs the five viscera—why then is the heart considered their master?
The answer: The heart resides at the center of the five viscera; its substance is emptiness and receptivity, the body of spirit-awareness and the source of function. Thus, it governs the directions and manifests its power, moving and acting to attain its numinous nature. It cannot be spoken in terms of images or numbers, nor grasped through material analogy—all is the Dao of spontaneity.

All operate within the heart, circulating the celestial scriptures—
The five viscera and six bowels each have their offices, modeling heaven and earth, aligning with yin and yang, the natural Dao of resonance and governance, hence *circulating the celestial scriptures*.

Preserve them day and night to attain longevity—
By visualizing these five spirits with their corresponding colors, one holds fast to the undying Dao.

The *Scripture of Immortals* states: Envision the qi of the five viscera transforming into five-colored clouds, covering the body from above. The sun resides before you, the moon behind; the Azure Dragon to the left, the White Tiger to the right; the Vermilion Bird in front, the Dark Warrior behind—this is the Dao of dispelling evil and attaining longevity.

**Lung Section Chapter IX**
The lung’s palace resembles a floral canopy—
A golden palace, for the lungs stand above the five viscera, their lobes like a canopy.

Below sits a youth within the Jade Tower—
The youth is named *Luminous Florescence*; the lungs’ form is canopy-like, hence described as below. The *Jade Tower* refers to the white qi within the kidneys, connecting upward to the lungs.

The Seven Origins’ child governs qi-regulation—
Master Yuan Yang states: The Lords of the Seven Origins bear armor and hold talismans, repelling inauspicious evil and distributing qi to the seven orifices, governing the acuity of ears and eyes. The *Seven Origins* are the primordial qi beyond the seven orifices.

Externally corresponding to the Central Peak’s nose and navel—
The *Central Peak* is the nose. It is also the navel, the navel being Kunlun. The nose is the gateway of the seven orifices, its position like that of a master.

Adorned in silken robes with a yellow-cloud sash—
*Silken* is the color of the lung’s membrane. The yellow membrane spreads and entwines, resembling cloud-like patterns.

When breathing becomes labored and the body feels unwell—
This occurs at times.

Swiftly visualize White Prime harmonizing the six qi—
White Prime Lord governs the lung palace. The *Great Cavern Scripture* states: “White Prime Lord resides to the right of the Cavern Chamber.”

The divine immortals’ long vision knows no harm—
Evil does not invade the upright.

When various illnesses assail, simply visualize the Peerless Hero, the Lord’s Son.

Constantly preserve the Three Elders to harmonize the hundred spirits,
Circulating through the bodily regions and nourishing defense, without error.

The peach pit harmonizes and extends life’s flowering splendor—

The attainment of divine transcendence becomes possible.
As the *Nanhua True Scripture* states: "One who can preserve the One brings all matters to completion."

Within the square inch, thoughts are deeply concealed—
The square inch refers to the Lower Pass,
A gate located three inches below the navel, one inch in circumference, for storing essence.
Neither square nor round, the windows and doors are sealed—
Square denotes stillness, round denotes movement;
Neither moving nor still, one must only block and seal, avoiding reckless dissipation.
The Three Spirits return essence, and the aged regain their vigor—
By returning essence to the Three Fields, longevity and extended years are achieved.
The hun and po guard within, free from contention—
The hun is yang, the po is yin, each attaining its unity.
As the *Book of Changes* states: "The Dao of one yin and one yang."
Spirit is born within the abdomen, bearing the Jade Stopper—
By guarding within without dissipation, spirit is born bearing the stopper,
The abdomen becomes inwardly luminous, the mouth emits pearls and jade.
According to the *Five Spirits’ Conduct Method*: "Three inches directly above the space between the eyebrows lies the Jade Stopper and Purple Pass."
The numinous infuses the Dark Gate—how could it be lost?
When spirit is born within the abdomen, the numinous qi flows unimpeded—thus it cannot perish.
Secure essence at the Gate of the Kidneys—
The kidneys govern water, their color is black, and their qi connects to the ears.
The "twin standing gates" symbolize their towering extremity.
Jade branches, ten thousand fathoms long, can serve as a canopy—
The body follows the multitude of spirits, resplendently interlaced,
Like a ten-thousand-fathom jade tree offering shade—
An external metaphor.
"Jade branches" refer to the branches of the jade tree;
"Ten thousand fathoms" denotes vast height, symbolizing the body’s form sheltered by the radiance of the perfected and the numinous.
The Three Hun rest in tranquility, and the Emperor’s decree is issued—
When the body’s spirits are at peace, the Emperor’s decree descends.
Once the true Dao is accomplished, one’s name is inscribed in the Emperor’s register,
Thus achieving enduring vision.

**Chapter Seventeen: The Numinous Terrace**

The Numinous Terrace is shrouded in mist, gazing toward the Yellow Wilds—
The heart is called the Numinous Terrace; the spleen, the Yellow Wilds.
One must focus and preserve the vision of the Yellow Court.
Three inches, distinct chambers, above and below—
The Three Elixir Fields—upper, middle, and lower—each distinct,
Every chamber one inch in circumference.
Even today, people refer to the heart as the "square inch," which is its meaning here.
Inquire of the Passes, the Guardians, and the Mysterious Receptacle—
Between the Three Fields lie the Passes and Guardians, each with its own division,
From the highest to the lowest, the heart must receive and preserve these with mindfulness.
The Grotto Chamber, the Purple Ultimate, the Numinous Gate—
The *Great Grotto Scripture* states:
Three fen between the eyebrows lies the Twin Elixir Fields;
Three fen into the bone lies the Astral Pass.
Precisely seven fen deep,
To the left is the Heart Chamber, to the right is the Purple Door.
One cun deeper lies the Hall of Brightness,
To the left dwells the Bright Lad True Lord, to the right the Bright Maiden True Lord.
Two cun deeper lies the Grotto Chamber,
To the left dwells the Peerless Lord, to the right the White Prime Lord,
At the center dwells the Yellow Elder Lord.
Three cun deeper lies the Elixir Field Chamber, also called the Muddy Pellet Palace,
Where the Upper Prime Red Child resides.
Four cun deeper lies the Flowing Pearl Palace,
Where the Flowing Pearl True Spirit dwells.
Five cun deeper lies the Jade Emperor’s Palace,
Where the Jade Clarity True Mother resides.
One cun above the Hall of Brightness lies the Heavenly Court Palace,
Where the Upper Clarity True Maiden dwells.
One cun above the Grotto Chamber lies the Ultimate Perfection Palace,
Where the Supreme Ultimate Empress dwells.
One cun above the Elixir Field lies the Mysterious Elixir Palace,
Where the Central August Grand Unity True Lord dwells.
One cun above the Flowing Pearl lies the Supreme August Palace,
Where the Supreme Lord dwells.
Thus, they are called the Numinous Gates.
These were once imparted to me by the Supreme—
"I" refers to Lord Fusang, the Great Emperor,
Who, having accomplished the Dao, received the transmission of the Yellow Court from the Dao Lord in former times.
This Dao is not distant—it resides in the Elixir Field—thus it is spoken of as "once."
The Divine Lord on the left utters divine speech—
According to the *Great Grotto Scripture*, to the left dwells the Peerless—here called the Divine Lord,
An interchangeable term.
"Utters divine speech" means that with focused intent, the spirit instructs one in the Dao.
To the right stands the White Prime—
Left and right serve as the supports for the cultivator of the Dao.
Between the Golden Coffer and the Jade Chamber—
All are palaces of the Upper Prime, explained as above.
The Upper Clarity Perfected stands before me—
The spirits of the Upper Prime all reside at the edge of the Heavenly Court.
The Yellow Garment Lad’s cinnabar qi frequently stirs—
Referring to the youth of the Middle Prime who dwells in the Crimson City.

chunks.original_text: 频烦，气盛不衰竭也。 借问何在两眉端， 明堂之所。 内挟日月列宿陈， 《五辰行事袂》云：太上真人招五辰洞房，南极元君传授。 每夜半坐外，心存西方太白星，在两眉问上直入於一寸玉当金阙，左日右月。 又次存北方辰星在帝乡玄官，玄官在发际五分直入一寸也。 又次存东方岁星在洞阙朱台，朱台在目后直入一寸是也。 又次存南方荧惑星在玉门华房，在目眦五分直入五分是也。 又次存中央镇星在金室长谷，在人中直入二分是也。 并存之如缀悬於上，毕，叩齿三通，咽液五过，微咒曰：高元紫阙，中有五神，宝耀发辉，放光冲门，精气顿生，化为老人，首巾素容，绿帔绛裙，右带流铃，左　　佩虎符，手把天罡，散辉飞辰，足蹑华盖，吐芒炼身，三景保守，令我得真，养魂制魄，乘飓飞仙。 其事内象法也。 七曜九元冠生门。 七曜，七星，即人之七窍。 九元，九辰，即人之九窍。 废一不可，故曰冠生门也。 三关章第十八 三关之中精气深， 谓关元之中，男子藏精之所也。 又据下文口手足为三关。 又，元阳子以明堂、洞房、丹田为三关。 并皆可以文义取之而存也。 九微之内幽且阴。 《大洞经》云：三元隐化则成三官，是名太清、太素、太和，三三如九，故有三丹田，又有三洞房，合上三元为九官。 官有精微，故日九微，言幽玄而不可见也。 口为天关精神机， 言发於情，犹枢机也。 手为人关把盛衰， 纵擒由己。 足为地关生命扉。 言运用己身而生也。 若得章第十九 若得三宫存玄丹， 三丹田官，故曰三官。 玄丹，丹元也。 存思在心，故偏指一所也。 太一流珠安昆仑。 太一流珠，谓目睛。 《洞神经》日：头为三台，君为昆仑，指上丹田也。 又云：脐为太一君，亦为昆仑，指上丹田也。 言心存三丹田，神皎然在於目前。 《本经》云：子欲不死修昆仑是也。 重重楼阁十二环， 谓喉咙十二环，相重重在心上。 心为绛官，有象楼阁故也。 自高自下皆真人。 高下三田十二楼阁，皆有真人。 释如上说。 玉堂绛宇尽玄宫， 绛官明堂，上下相应，皆官室也。 璇玑玉衡色兰玕， 喉骨环圆，转动之象。 兰玕，其色一也。 瞻望童子坐盘桓。 存见赤城童子子丹真人。 坐，言其神安静也。 问谁家子在我身， 言己有之。

"Frequently stirs" means the qi flourishes without exhaustion.
I ask: where lies the space between the brows?
It is the abode of the Hall of Light.
Within, the sun and moon and constellations array themselves—
The *Five Celestial Rites of the Sleeves* states: The Supreme Perfected summons the Five Celestial Palaces of the Grotto Chamber, transmitted by the South Pole Primordial Lord.
Each midnight, sit facing outward and visualize the Western White Star of Venus between the brows, directly entering one inch into the Jade Gate of the Golden Tower, with the sun to the left and the moon to the right.

Next, visualize the Southern Star of Mars in the Flowery Chamber of the Jade Gate—five fen within the eye’s corner, directly entering five fen.
Finally, visualize the Central Star of Saturn in the Golden Chamber of the Long Valley—two fen directly within the philtrum.
Visualize them all as if suspended above, then knock the teeth three times, swallow saliva five times, and softly intone:
*"Lofty and purple the celestial towers,
Within dwell five spirits,
Treasure-bright, radiant beams,
Light surging through the gates.
Essence and qi swiftly arise,
Transforming into an elder,
Head wrapped in white,
Green mantle, crimson skirt,
Right side bearing flowing bells,
Left side wearing the tiger tally,
Hand grasping the Celestial Stem,
Scattering radiance, flying stars,
Feet treading the flowery canopy,
Exhaling rays to refine the body.
The Three Luminants guard and preserve,
Granting me attainment of the True,
Nurturing the hun, restraining the po,
Riding the whirlwind to ascend as an immortal."*
This practice is the inner visualization method.

Seven luminaries and nine origins crown the Gate of Life.
The seven luminaries are the seven stars, corresponding to the seven apertures of the human body.
The nine origins are the nine celestial bodies, corresponding to the nine apertures.
None may be neglected, hence they are said to crown the Gate of Life.

**Chapter Eighteen: The Three Passes**
Within the Three Passes, essence and qi run deep—
Referring to the Pass of Origin, where men store their essence.
Alternatively, as stated below, the mouth, hands, and feet are the Three Passes.
Or, as Master Yuanyang holds, the Hall of Light, Grotto Chamber, and Elixir Field are the Three Passes.
All may be taken according to the text’s meaning and preserved in practice.
Within the Nine Subtleties, it is dark and yin—
The *Great Grotto Scripture* states: The Three Primes conceal transformations to form the Three Palaces, named Great Clarity, Great Simplicity, and Great Harmony. Three times three makes nine, hence there are three Elixir Fields and three Grotto Chambers, combining with the Three Primes to form Nine Palaces. Each palace holds subtle essence, thus called the Nine Subtleties, meaning they are profound and unseen.
The mouth is the Heavenly Pass, the mechanism of spirit—
It expresses emotions like the pivot of a trigger.
The hands are the Human Pass, grasping prosperity or decline—
Whether to release or seize lies within oneself.
The feet are the Earthly Pass, the gateway of life—
They govern the movement of one’s body and thus one’s vitality.

**Chapter Nineteen: If Attained**
If one attains the Three Palaces and preserves the Mysterious Elixir—
The Three Palaces are the three Elixir Fields.
The Mysterious Elixir is the primordial cinnabar.
Visualization resides in the heart, hence it specifically refers to one locus.
The flowing pearl of the Great One rests upon Kunlun—
The flowing pearl of the Great One refers to the pupils of the eyes.
The *Scripture of Grotto Spirits* states: The head is the Three Terraces, the ruler is Kunlun, referring to the Upper Elixir Field.
It also says: The navel is the Lord of the Great One, also called Kunlun, referring to the Upper Elixir Field.
It speaks of visualizing the Three Elixir Fields, where the spirit shines clearly before one’s eyes.
The *Root Scripture* states: If you wish not to die, cultivate Kunlun.
Layer upon layer, the twelve-storied towers coil—
Referring to the twelve rings of the throat, stacked above the heart.
The heart is the Crimson Palace, resembling a towered pavilion.
From high to low, all are Perfected Ones—
The three fields and twelve towers all house Perfected Ones,
as explained above.
The Jade Hall and Crimson Palace are all Mysterious Palaces—
The Crimson Palace and Hall of Light correspond above and below, all being chambers.
The jade pivot and balance beam gleam like orchid and jade—
The throat bones form a circular, rotating structure.
Orchid and jade share a single hue.
I gaze upon the youth who sits in tranquil repose—
Visualizing the Cinnabar Perfected Youth of the Crimson City.
"Sits" denotes the spirit’s serenity.
I ask: whose child dwells within my body?
It is to say: he is one’s own.

Where has this person gone but into the Mud-Pill Palace?
In harmony with the Upper Prime’s host of spirits, above and below in accord.
The scripture states: the brain is the Mud-Pill Palace.
By thousands and hundreds they link themselves—
The spirit originally emerges from the One,
the One generates the Two,
the Two generates the Three,
the Three generates the myriad things,
all transformations never depart from body and heart.
Twenty upon twenty like layered mountains—
Visualizing the myriad things seated in layered repose.
Mountains resemble the form of sitting.

Cloud-ornaments and jade blossoms flank the ear-gate—
Cloud-ornaments and jade blossoms are names for the temples’ hair,
for the ears reside between them.
The *Great Cavern Scripture* says: the spirit of the hair is named Azure Blossom.
Whenever it speaks of “blossom,” it is like the blossom of grasses and trees.

The Crimson Thearch and Yellow Elder accompany my hun-soul—
The Crimson Thearch is the Lord of the Southern Quarter.
The Yellow Elder Lord is the Lord of the Central Quarter.
The hun is the yang spirit, the po the yin spirit;
yin and yang respond to each other, thus it speaks of accompanying the hun.
The *Luminous Writ of the Grand Tenuity* states:
humans possess three hun-souls—
the first is Fetal Radiance,
the second is Luminous Effulgence,
the third is Dark Essence.
Constantly invoking their names ensures the three hun-souls never leave the body.

Three Perfected Ones support the axle, sharing the ford and qi—
The hun, the Crimson Thearch, and the Yellow Elder are the Three Perfected Ones,
said to respond in mutual support, sharing the ford and qi.
The Five Ladles gleam bright as the Seven Primes—
The Five Ladles are the Five Stars of the Northern Dipper.
The *Ordinance of the Cavern Chamber* says:
to visualize the Seven Prime Celestials,
whether upon rising, at the first outing, or after meals,
recite the incantation:
“The Five Stars open the way,
the Six Harmonies are the Purple Chamber.
Return to the Hidden Dao,
the Seven Celestials shine resplendent.
The begetter of the hun-soul is the Dark Father,
transforming the One to become spirit.
The begetter of the po-soul is the Dark Mother,
transforming the Two to become the body.
The Master of my sinews and bones is the Noble Son,
the White Prime governs my essence and qi.
Long life and enduring vision,
ascend as an immortal to the Ten Heavens.”

The sun and moon fly coursing through the Six Harmonies—
Within Heaven and Earth is the Six Harmonies;
visualize the sun, moon, stars, and constellations within the body,
the myriad images all as clear as within a single day.
The Emperor’s homeland at the center of Heaven, the Earth’s gate at its end—
Five fen above the brows, one cun straight in is the Emperor’s homeland.
Moreover, one cun above the Hall of Light is the Heavenly Court,
that is, the center of Heaven.
Moreover, the nose is the Earth’s gate of the upper region.
Visualizing the sun, moon, stars, and other spirits,
they always reside at its end—
that is, above the nose and below the hairline.

The facial hun-spirits and gods all abide in mutual presence—
The inner and outer heart-spirits and eyes respond to each other.

**Breathing Chapter the Twentieth**

Inhaling and exhaling primordial qi to seek immortality—
Probing the flying root and mysterious radiance,
swallowing the Five Sprouts and embracing the Nine Clouds,
the method of fetal breathing,
referring to the qi of Heaven and Earth, yin and yang, the four seasons, and the Five Phases.
The Immortal Duke and Noble Son seem to stand before one—
This is the *Ordinance of the Cavern Chamber*.
The left of the Cavern Chamber is the Peerless Flower, also named the Noble Son.
The Immortal Duke directly indicates the Yellow Court.
If the Yellow Court’s Immortal Duke can practice the Cavern Chamber’s ordinance
and visualize its Noble Son, thus they are said to stand before one.

The Vermilion Crow retracts and extends from the White Stone Source—
The Vermilion Crow is the image of the tongue.
The White Stone is the image of the teeth.
Retracting and extending guide the fluid essence,
regulating the qi of yin and yang,
flowing without cease—thus it is called the Source.

Congealing essence and nurturing the embryo to transform and generate the body—
The origin from which one’s self has come.
Preserving the embryo and halting essence can grant long life—
The *True Sayings* state:
the oral instructions of the Upper Clarity Perfected Ones—
those who study the Dao should pacify the heart and nurture the spirit,
ingesting and refining to cure illness,
ensuring the Mud-Pill Palace is filled and the mysterious essence does not spill,
only then can one preserve form and spirit,
ingesting cloud-souls and exhaling-inhaling the Two Luminaries.
If one frequently engages in intercourse and leaks essence,
the practitioner’s qi becomes foul, the spirit perishes,
essence and numen wither and deplete.
Even if one wears the Dark Stem and bears the Jade Register,
the Golden Writ of the Great Ultimate,
how can one resolve this to attain life?
In former times, my late teacher often cautioned against this matter, saying:
for those who study,
one act of intercourse spills the efficacy of one year’s medicinal practice,
two acts spill two years’ efficacy.
Beyond this, the unspilled medicine entirely vanishes from the body.
Thus, the true immortals are ever vigilant in this regard,
for it is the great taboo of life’s generation.

The Three Qi revolve to the right, the Nine Paths grow bright—
The Three Qi are the qi of the Three Cinnabar Fields.
“Revolve to the right” means circulating in orderly sequence,
harmonizing yin and yang so the Four Passes and Nine Orifices flow freely,
luminous and free of illness.
Uprightness and unity with the blossom bring fullness—
Embracing uprightness and guarding the One,
the spirit and qi flourish in blossom,
thus one can fill the Six Harmonies,
riding things and transforming them.
Gazing afar, the heart is like a net’s star—
Visualizing the Cinnabar Perfected Youth dwelling within the Crimson City,
like a star shining in the net’s valley.
Beneath the Golden Chamber it cannot topple—
The heart resides below the lungs,
governing metal, its color white—
thus the Golden Chamber should always be visualized,
granting long life without death.
Extending my white-haired years to return to infancy—
An internal matter.
It refers to an ageless childlike countenance.

**Jade Chamber Chapter the Twenty-First**

Within the Jade Chamber, enter the plain assembly—
Referring to the Upper Prime’s pure and true.

They interconnect with the Flowing Pearl, the Five Thearchs, the Celestial Court, the Ultimate Truth, the Mysterious Cinnabar, the Mud-Pill Palace, the Grand August, and all other palaces—left and right, above and below—forming a seamless whole. As the scripture states: On the day of the Beginning of Spring, at cock’s crow, enter the chamber, face east, and bow nine times. Sit upright, click the teeth nine times, and visualize the Nine Worthies of the Eastern Quarter—Anbao, Hualin, Qingling, and the Nine Thousand Lords of the Primordial Elder—descending into the chamber in a dense cloud. Their forms enter through the mouth and descend directly into the liver palace. Recite the incantation:

Primordial essence of the Supreme Origin,
Venerable Lords of the August Elder,
Clad in feathered azure,
Presiding over the Celestial Offices,
Radiant as Jupiter’s splendor,

I drink the essence of wood,
Nurturing the Azure Sprout,

Prolonging years and refining complexion,

Clad in five-colored crimson robes, they reside above the spleen palace, beneath the canopy of yellow clouds. The Six Dings are the six yin spirits of the jade maidens. The Ding-chou spirit is the Jade Maiden Zhao Ziwang, who harmonizes *qi*. The Ding-hai spirit is the Jade Maiden Zhang Wentong, who purifies all. The Ding-si spirit is the Jade Maiden Cui Juqing, who hears the heart’s intent. To ingest the Flying Root is to practice the method of rinsing the Yellow Sprout; upon mastery, one commands the Six Ding spirits.

Guard the chamber of essence and do not recklessly discharge it.
The chamber of essence refers to the three cinnabar fields, interconnected and unbroken. Its regulation lies in the heart, which is the middle cinnabar field—the source of urgency and ease, the root of truth and delusion. Sealed and preserved, it ensures longevity. This is the result of accumulating essence.

Arising from within the form, never apart—
This speaks of the heart directing *qi*, subtle and formless.

The three palaces lie near, easily concealed and gathered.
The three cinnabar fields’ true lords reside within the body. Concealing and gathering essence, the heart must serve as their sovereign.

Visualize the hundred thoughts and observe the rhythm.
Visualize the hundred spirits within the body, their breath rising and falling in accordance with the prescribed method. It is also said: "Thousands upon thousands, hundreds upon hundreds, like layered mountains"—all are divine images.

Cultivate the six palaces and do not let them decay.
According to the *Cavern Spirit Scripture*, the six palaces are: the lungs as the Jade Hall Palace, the Office of the Chief Minister; the heart as the Crimson Palace, the Primordial Yang Office; the liver as the Clear and Cold Palace, the Orchid Terrace Office; the gallbladder as the Purple Tenuity Palace, the Boundless Office; the kidneys as the Pastoral Palace, the Supreme Harmony Office; and the spleen as the Central Yellow Palace, the Grand Simplicity Office. The Dao of nurturing life is not burdensome,
Embracing non-action, purity, and simplicity,
Restraining oneself and upholding rectitude.

The *Jade Canon’s* true script is the *Huangting*.

The Five Phases are Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, and Earth. Their mutual generation proceeds thus: Metal engenders Water, Water engenders Wood, Wood engenders Fire, Fire engenders Earth, Earth engenders Metal, cycling endlessly. Their mutual restraint follows this pattern: Fire restrains Metal, Metal restrains Wood, Wood restrains Earth, Earth restrains Water, Water restrains Fire, likewise cycling without cease. This mutual generation is the Dao.

Returning to the One—One is the number of Water, the root of the Five Phases’ Dao and the origin of the myriad things. As Laozi says: “The Dao gives birth to the One, the One gives birth to the Two, the Two gives birth to the Three, and the Three give birth to the myriad things.” The *Book of Changes* likewise states: “The Supreme Polarity gives rise to the Two Modes.” The Supreme Polarity is the One; the Two Modes are Heaven and Earth. Heaven and Earth give birth to the myriad things, and the myriad things in turn return to the One. The One is the designation of Non-Being, from which all things are accomplished—hence it is called “returning to the One.”

The Three and Five unite their qi in the nine-by-nine nodes. The *Scripture of Wondrous Perfection* states: “The Three are: in Heaven, the sun, moon, and stars; on Earth, pearls, jade, and gold—these are called the Three Treasures. In the human body, they are the ears, mouth, and nose—termed the Three Vitalities.” Heaven, Earth, and Humanity are the Three Powers, each containing them. The Five are the essence of the Sovereign; thus it is said “Three-Five unite.” Three times three makes nine.

The Three and Five that are contained regulate all categories, harmonize the myriad things, govern the transformation of yin and yang, cover and support Heaven and Earth, illuminate the Four Seas, and generate wind, rain, thunder, and lightning, the four seasons of spring, summer, autumn, and winter, the alternations of cold, heat, warmth, and coolness, and the qi of purity and turbidity. None of the living things can arise without the union of Three and Five. Thus it is said: “The Dao of Heaven is not distant; the Three and Five return again.”

The Three and Five are the repository of Heaven and Earth, the essential convergence of the Six Directions, and the qi-nodes of the Nine Palaces. Nine times nine makes eighty-one, which forms a single chapter. One may employ the Eight Concealments to revolve through the Eight Guards. Within the Nine Palaces lie the arts of concealment and transformation—this is the *Hidden Writ of the Eight Qi Rushing to the Celestial Court*, called the Eight Evolutions. There are also the Eight Evolutions of the Supreme Polarity. Within the Supreme Polarity are the Three Lords: the first is the Supreme August Lord, the second is the Heavenly August Lord, and the third is the Yellow Elder Lord. The qi of the Three Origins and the essence of primordial chaos enter and exit the Palace of Grand Clarity in the Supreme Void, concealed and formless—thus is the Dao of long life attained.

The Crouching Ox guards the Dark Gate in ranked array. The Crouching Ox is an image of the kidneys; the kidneys are the Dark Gate. The *Central Yellow Scripture* states: “The left kidney is the Mysterious Wondrous Perfected One; the right kidney is the Mysterious Origin Lord.” When their ranks and positions are visualized, they become visible.

The Three Luminaries emerge at the boundary of life and death. Heaven’s Three Luminaries are the sun, moon, and stars; Earth’s Three Luminaries are the patterns of literature and brilliance; Humanity’s Three Luminaries are the ears, nose, and mouth—these mark the boundary of life and death.

The Cavern Chamber’s numinous image rivals the sun and moon. Visualize the Three Origins within the Cavern Chamber. The Cavern Chamber and Bright Hall have been explained above.

The father is the Muddy Pellet; the mother, the Feminine One. Within the Bright Hall are ruler and ministers; within the Cavern Chamber, husband and wife; within the Cinnabar Field, father and mother. The Muddy Pellet is the name of the brain spirit. The *Laozi* states: “Know the masculine, but keep to the feminine.” The Feminine is Non-Action—this is the One.

The Three Lights radiantly illumine the Chamber of the Child. Clarity extends in all four directions.

If one can preserve the Mysterious Perfected, all affairs are complete. As Zhuangzi says: “If one can guard the One, all affairs are complete.”

The spirit and essence of the body must not be lost. Constantly maintain this awareness, not neglecting it even for a moment.

Wielding a sword a hundred yards long while dancing amidst brocade feasts—such is the form of the divine soldiers and their swords. The Ten Absolutes span the void like fluttering fans, shaping qi in the emptiness with dazzling, sweeping radiance. Fire bells crown the heavens, plummeting like descending smoke: golden essence and fire bells pierce the celestial vault, their ranks and formations resembling clouds massing like drifting smoke. All this resides within the Yellow Gate between the brows. Visualize the fiery soldiers and their qi, all gathered at the Heavenly Court. The Heavenly Court, also called the Yellow Gate, is located between the brows. This is no mere branch or leaf—it is the very root of immortal cultivation.

**Purple Clarity, Chapter Twenty-Nine**
The Purple Clarity Supreme August Lord of the Great Dao,
Also named the Jade Celestial Palace.
Flanking the Great Mystery and Great Harmony in solemn attendance—
The Great Mystery and Great Harmony are the honorific titles of perfected immortals.
They transform and give life to the myriad things, making me immortal,
For such is the power of the Dao’s qi.
Ascending through the Ten Heavens in a jade chariot,
Riding reverently onward.
Meditate day and night for seven days without sleep,
With utmost sincerity and deepest resonance.
If you can cultivate this, you may endure forever,
The way of transcendent longevity.
Accumulating merit and refining the self is no natural occurrence,
But through study one governs the Dao.
This arises from unwavering sincerity and holding fast to the One,
Guarding the One as at first, with surplus to attain the Way.
Internally guard with steadfastness the true within the true,
Progressing step by step.
In emptiness and tranquility, the spirit comes of itself,
For the spirit receives through the void.

**The Hundred Grains, Chapter Thirty**
The essence of the hundred grains is the essence of the earth,
For grains are the fruit of the soil, belonging to the yin class.
Their five flavors, though outwardly fine, reek of demonic filth,
Not the true qi of pure emptiness.
They disturb the spirit and scatter the fetal qi,
Fetal qi refers to the flavorless flavor, the upright qi of spontaneity.
In the practice of qi absorption, there is a proper method for fetal breathing.
*Ling* means loss.
How then can one reverse aging and return to infancy?
Hair turns from white to black, fallen teeth regrow.
This line should follow "governing the spirit oneself," for here it seems out of place.
The three hun-souls drift aimlessly, the po-souls crumble and collapse—
*Aimlessly* means without tranquility.
*Crumble and collapse* means decay and ruin.
Why not consume the essence of the Great Harmony’s qi?
Advance in the way of refinement and absorption.
Thus one may enter the Yellow Tranquility without dying,
Yellow Tranquility is the accomplishment of the Yellow Court’s Way.

**Heart Canon, Chapter Thirty-One**
The Heart Canon is the sovereign of the five viscera,
For the spirit receives through the void, and the heart is the dwelling of the spirit, hence its kingship.
In movement and stillness, contemplate the conduct of the Dao and virtue.
*Contemplate* refers to meditating on the Cinnabar Origin Youth.
Thought is being, aspiration is non-being;
With thought, the heart is easily swayed before speech, but with non-being, the heart is ashen and the spirit whole—hence the conduct of the Dao and virtue.
Purity and good qi naturally radiate luminous clarity,
Through constant contemplation.
In sitting and rising, I together serve as the pillar and beam,
For the spirit takes the body as its dwelling, thus they share the pillar and beam.
*I* refers to the Cinnabar Origin Youth.
By day it shines with brilliance, by dusk it closes and conceals,
As Zhuangzi said: "When awake, the hun-souls open; when asleep, the hun-souls intermingle and close."
It unblocks and harmonizes the flowery essence to regulate yin and yang,
This refers to the heart spirit’s engagement and withdrawal, corresponding with the eyes.
*Flowery essence* is the essence of the eyes.
When the heart opens, the eyes open; by day it is yang, by night it is yin—hence the regulation of yin and yang.

**Passing Through, Chapter Thirty-Two**
Passing through the Six Harmonies, concealed at dawn and dusk—
This describes the heart’s function and the origin of yin and yang.
By day it passes through, by night it conceals.
The Six Harmonies are the four directions, above and below.
Dawn and dusk take the north as night, belonging to the hidden and obscure.
The spirits of the two kidneys govern longevity,
The kidney spirit is Dark Obscurity.
Nurturing the infant belongs to the north, governing the night; one who refines the heart may attain long life.
As the *Master by the River* said: "The kidneys store essence."
Descending in turn to lodge in the Dipper’s first nine,
Nine is the yang number.
The Dipper is the Northern Asterism, governing the descent of yang—yang qi descends to unite with yin.
The *Book of Changes* says: "Qian’s fortune lies in the primal head," where it is stored.
Knowing the masculine yet guarding the feminine, one may avoid aging,
Guarding the feminine is the text of "hiding the nine."
Knowing the white yet seeing the black, one sits in vigilant guard.
As the *Laozi* says: "Know the white, guard the black; know the masculine, guard the feminine"—this is the text of "hiding the nine."

**Liver Qi, Chapter Thirty-Three**

The liver’s qi surges, clear and enduring;
The liver resides in the east, governing spring—root of the generative qi.
Clear and enduring describe the aspect of its qi and complexion.
Arrayed like the six palaces, it gives rise to the Three Luminaries.
By storing the thought of generative qi, it illumines the five viscera and six bowels,
As the sun, moon, and stars radiate their primal brilliance.
The heart’s essence and intent concentrate within, unwavering—
This is the knowledge of the One.
Like rain moistening the myriad things, the jade nectar nourishes the hundred limbs.
Mysterious fluid flows as clouds, banishing foulness and bearing fragrance—
When true qi circulates freely, no calamity or illness arises.
It purifies the teeth and hair, refining the Five Directions;
As clouds drift and rain descends, nothing remains obstructed—hence the Five Directions and Five Viscera.
Draw the fluid from the Mysterious Throat into the Bright Hall.
The way of swallowing saliva requires it to descend from the Mysterious Throat into the throat.
The throat, also called the Towering Pavilion, leads below to the Bright Hall,
And beneath the Bright Hall lies the Grotto Chamber, and below that, the Cinnabar Field—
This is the middle region.
Below, the throat’s spirit connects with the numinous;
Life and destiny depend upon the fluid and qi.
Sit in attendance beneath the Flowery Canopy, wandering the Noble Capital—
The Flowery Canopy is the lungs; the liver lies beneath them.
The Noble Capital is the Cinnabar Field.
Gently it courses through the Three Pures, resting upon the clear and cool—
The Three Emperors are the Lords of the Three Cinnabar Fields, also called Perfected Ones.
The liver’s qi, drifting and flowing, pervades the three Cinnabar Fields.
As the liver’s qi is the essence of the eyes, it rests upon the cool and clear.
Five-colored cloud-qi swirls in verdant profusion—
The liver’s qi, mingling with the five viscera, forms clouds.
Close the eyes and gaze inward to behold them,
Ever storing the thought, the five viscera appear of themselves.
Thus the heart’s spirits return to revere themselves—
The Crimson Youth is the Perfected One of the heart’s viscus,
Harmonizing and uniting with the same palace in mutual reverence.
The Seven Mysterious Flowers open the Gate of Destiny—
The seven orifices flow freely, without stagnation.
Unobstructed, the heavenly Dao abides in the Mysterious Root—
The body is the root.
One may yet return even at a hundred and twenty years;
Hasten to cultivate the practice, for time must not be lost.
Beyond this, guarding the Dao becomes truly difficult—
Death draws near.
Only the Ninefold Transmutation and Eightfold Jade Elixir remain—
The Ninefold Transmutation Divine Elixir grants ascent to heaven in broad daylight.
The *Baopuzi’s* "Discourse on the Nine Elixirs" states: "The Old Man perused the books of nurturing life and collected the methods for prolonging vision, having examined thousands of scrolls. None failed to regard the Returning Elixir and Golden Fluid as the great essentials."
The *Yellow Emperor’s Scripture of the Nine Cauldrons’ Divine Elixir* says: "The Emperor consumed it and ascended as an immortal, his destiny conjoined with heaven and earth, riding clouds and driving dragons, entering and exiting the Grand Purity."
The Eight Jades are cinnabar, realgar, azurite, sulfur, mica, halite, lodestone, and orpiment.
Yet one must also refine the thought and store the Seven Primes—
Though consuming the divine elixir, one must also practice the Way of the Yellow Court.
The Seven Primes refer to the true spirits of the seven stars and seven orifices.
Alternatively, the Five Emperor Lords and the White Prime and Radiant Prime Lords transform into the Seven Prime Lords.
The *Scripture of the Grotto Chamber* states: "To store the Seven Primes, recite the incantation: *Return the Prime to conceal the Dao, the Seven Stars shine resplendent.*"
The Seven Stars are the Seven Primes.
The effulgences of the sun and moon rescue the aged and infirm—
The left eye governs the sun, the right eye the moon; the eyes govern the liver.
Death belongs to the east, the phase of wood.
Wood’s position is spring, spring is the generative qi—hence it rescues the aged and infirm.
The liver’s qi circulates endlessly without cease.
As *Zhuangzi* says: "Fat is exhausted as kindling, yet fire is transmitted; life receives sustenance and destiny is stored therein."

**Lung Qi, Chapter Thirty-Four**

The lung’s qi arises from the Triple Burner—
The *Central Yellow Scripture* states: "The lung’s head is the Triple Burner."
The lung’s qi refers to the qi’s rinsing, which originates from the Triple Burner.
Those who speak of the Triple Burner often fail to grasp its true nature, mistakenly regarding it as the tubes above the three viscera.
"Burner" means heat, signifying the heat of the heart, liver, and lungs.
Watch and listen in darkness, awaiting the Youth—
The Youth is the heart’s spirit, the one within the Crimson City.

**Chapter Thirty-Five: Concealing the Feathered Canopy**

Conceal the feathered canopy to gaze upon the heavenly abode—
This speaks of the spleen’s palace.
The spleen’s palace is the Yellow Court of the Cinnabar Field, the central earth of *wu* and *ji*.
Looking upward, the liver and lungs become the canopy’s abode—
Thus is the spleen’s domain.

Pay homage to the Great Simplicity, joyfully calling one another.
The host of spirits gathers in the spleen’s palace, revering the Supreme Divine Immortals, delighting in mutual summoning—
This is the hun-soul uniting with the assembly of immortals.
The *Scripture of Numinous Simplicity* states: "The Supreme Divine Immortals include the Lord of Great Simplicity, the Lord of Great Void, and the Lord of Luminous Purity; the multitude of immortals follow the Dao, roaming in joy."

The radiant spirits of the Eight Might expel perversity with rectitude—
The Eight Numinous Spirits possess luminous virtue, upholding the true method to dispel evil and guard the spleen’s palace.
The Eight Might are the Eight Numinous Spirits.
The *True Records* say: "The incantation of the Northern Thearch for slaying ghosts states: 'The Seven Governors and Eight Numinous Ones, the Supreme White and Terrible, the long-skulled giant beasts, wielding the Thearch’s mallet, riding the three-tiered jade carriage, sternly driving the kui-dragons.'"
This is the method of guardianship, destroying evil and banishing misfortune—it is fitting to recite it.

The spleen spirit returns to the stomach’s household—
The spleen serves the stomach’s function, thus the spirit returns to it.
The spleen spirit’s name is *Changzai*, its cognomen *Hunting*.
The spleen grinds food and aids digestion—this is the stomach’s work.
The *Central Yellow Scripture* says: "The stomach is the Great Granary, the Great Granary is the spleen’s storehouse."

Nurturing the numinous root, it shall not wither—
Cultivating the Yellow Court’s spirit, cherishing and nourishing life, it shall not decay.
The spleen is the Yellow Court, the root of human life—
Focus the mind on its cultivation to prolong years and attain immortality.

Seal the Gate of Life to protect the Jade Capital—
The body is the Jade Capital; closing the Gate of Life in the Cinnabar Field preserves essence.
Master Primal Yang says: "The Gate of Life is the place where the essence-qi of the lower Cinnabar Field enters and exits, the spirit’s passage."
The body is the Jade Capital, where the spirit gathers—like a metropolis.

The myriad spirits then repay with abundant longevity—
The host of numina bestows blessings, extending one’s years.
*Repay* means recompense.
The myriad spirits reward nurturance, thus longevity overflows.

This is the spleen established in the Central Palace—
The spleen governs the Central Palace, the station of earth’s virtue.
The five viscera and six bowels are ruled by the Yellow Center—
The Yellow Center takes the spleen as its lord.

Ascend to unite with the Heavenly Gate and enter the Hall of Light—
Store the qi of the five viscera and six bowels to ascend and unite with the Heavenly Gate.
The Heavenly Gate lies between the brows—this is the Heavenly Court.
One *cun* inward from the brows is the Hall of Light.

Preserve the feminine and store the masculine, embracing the Three Lights—
The *Scripture of Laozi* states: "Know the masculine, preserve the feminine."
The feminine is the *yin* valley, yielding and weak.
The Three Lights are the sun, moon, and stars.

Externally square and internally round, the spirit abides within—
Externally square and internally round is the form of the Hall of Light; the spleen spirit and True Unity dwell at the center.

Harmonizing the blood and vessels, the five viscera flourish—
The spirit is tranquil, the mind is clear.
Bones turn green, sinews red, marrow like frost—
The hundred bones and nine orifices are all made true.

The spleen rescues the seven orifices, dispelling misfortune—
The spleen channels stomach-qi to respond to the external orifices, warding off evil and repelling malignity.
The spleen grinds food and aids digestion—ears hear clearly, eyes see brightly.

The sun and moon array themselves, setting forth *yin* and *yang*—
Qi spreads between the brows, left as *yang*, right as *yin*.
The sun governs *yang* and males, the moon governs *yin* and females.

When the two spirits meet, they transform into jade nectar—
*Yin* and *yang* harmonize to generate essence, transforming male and female.
*Yin* and *yang* are the body’s natural fluids.

Tasteless yet the sustenance of heaven and man—
When the spirit achieves harmony, it savors the flavorless.

The Child Cinnabar advances hunger with true yellow—
The youthful adept uses yellow qi as food to nourish it.
*Advances* means qi.
The Child Cinnabar is the true adept, the true qi of the Cinnabar Field.
The spleen is the Central Yellow, grinding food.

Thus it is called *langao* and jade frost—
The color and form of the fluids and essence-qi.

The Supreme Concealed Ring of the Eight Pure Jades—
The throat is called the Tower of Nine Stories, named the Supreme Concealed Ring, containing the Eight Pure Jade Fluids.
It holds the Eight Pure Jade Fluids; the Crimson Palace’s Tower of Nine Stories has twelve rings, within which the Eight Purities produce fluids.

Irrigating the Eight Fluids, the kidneys receive essence—
It nourishes the Eight Fluids, which enter the kidneys as jade essence; swallowing the fluids, they flow down into the kidneys’ palace, transforming into jade essence.

Concealed in the Great Yin, beholding my form—
The kidneys are the Great Yin; *yang* lies concealed within—this is the embryo’s form.
The Great Yin is the Grotto Chamber.
This speaks of observing the form of the jade fluids.

Raising the wind of the Three Mysteries, issuing forth the first green—
The kidneys belong to the Three Winters, their color is dark; when *yin* reaches its extreme, spring is born, emitting *yang* as green qi.
*Raising the wind* means transformation.
The *yin* and *yang* qi and the kidneys’ qi make three—three gives birth to the myriad things, subtle and wondrous, thus called the Three Mysteries.
*Issuing forth the first green* means the myriad things generate the color green.
The *Scripture of Great Peace* states: "Accumulating purity forms green."

In the realm of the indistinct and imperceptible, reaching utmost clarity—
The Three Mysteries’ nature arises; their qi is subtle and wondrous, not to be sought in form or substance—
Only in the realm of the indistinct and imperceptible can one attain the state of utmost clarity, where the *yin* and *yang* qi are most subtle.

Playing upon the Terrace of Whirling Winds, beholding the Red-Born—
Roaming atop the Terrace of Whirling Winds, one sees the True Person of the Red Child.
This speaks of harmonious qi transforming into the Red Child.
The Red Child is the True Person.
The Terrace of Whirling Winds is the gathering place of divine immortals.

In the carefree realm, nurturing the flourishing of the true—
Frolicking upon the Terrace of Whirling Winds is the carefree realm, gazing upon the true sages.
Delighting in the true qi beyond the material world is natural nurturance.

Inwardly gazing in silence, refining the five forms—
Rarely glimpsing the true sages, one turns the gaze inward to cultivate the body, preserving the spirit and qi for long life.

The Three Qi meander, attaining the numinous illumination—
Inwardly gazing to refine the form, the qi of the Three Fields circulates, achieving communion with the numinous spirits.
These are the qi of the Three Cinnabar Fields.

The Hidden Dragon conceals the zhi-clouds and jade blossoms—
The liver and gallbladder are the Hidden Dragon; the orifices and vessels are the inner zhi.
The spleen’s qi transforms the myriad fluids, all becoming jade blossoms.
The *Immortals’ Scripture* states: "The liver and gallbladder are the Green Dragon," thus *concealing the zhi-clouds and jade blossoms* refers to the spleen’s qi and fluids.

Zhi-blossoms grant freedom from hunger, driving and dispatching all spirits.
When the Dao of imbibing qi is perfected, ghosts and gods are made to serve.

Above, the Darkest Mystery; below, the Tiger Seal—
When the Dao of refinement is achieved, the heavens bestow the divine tiger and jade seal,
the raiment of immortals and transcendents.
The *Yuanlu Scripture* states: "Transcendents possess the Dark Feather Canopy and the Divine Tiger Seal."

**Chapter Thirty-Six: The Ritual of Bathing**

Bathe in utmost purity, forsaking rich meats and pungent aromas—
This marks the method of entering stillness and upholding the scripture.
*Sheng* (盛) is the ancient form of *jing* (净, purity).
*Fei* (肥) refers to fish, meat, and the five pungent plants.

Enter the chamber facing east to recite the jade scripture—
Toward the Great Emperor, who resides in the east.
When the count of ten thousand recitations is fulfilled, meaning becomes radiantly clear,
emerging naturally from within the body.

Let the hair flow unbound, free of desire, to abide in longevity—
Unfettered and desireless, one attains long years.
The *Immortals’ Scripture* states: "To ingest the Nine Radiances, first loosen the hair."
The *Embryonic Breathing Method* says: "Lie supine with hair unbound."
Some say: First cast aside worldly desires, loosen the hair, and let the pillow rise one inch and two fen.
Clasp the thumbs, make fists, close the eyes, and extend the arms five inches from the body.
Gargle the mouth’s fluid, swallow it fully, then gently draw in breath through the nose,
taking five or six breaths before exhaling—one inhalation and one exhalation count as a single breath.
After ten exhalations, stretch the limbs; once stretched, repeat the practice.
Complete forty-nine cycles to finish one round.
Yet the meaning here suggests that loosening the hair is not solely for this method,
but rather an expression of unbounded ease and natural attainment.

The five flavors all return to the upright qi—
Spirit congeals, fluids flow, and the upright qi enters the viscera,
manifesting the five flavors in harmony.
Unite the five into one—this is the natural Dao.

Calm the heart, still the mind, and let no vexation arise—
With no heart to perceive, stillness comes naturally.
*Men* (闷) means quietude, a state of serene purity.
Laozi said: "Its governance is unhurried, its people are simple and sincere."

When the count is complete, body and spirit become refined—
Once the count is fulfilled, the body enters the wondrous void, a result of single-minded devotion.
The Jade Maiden of Yellow Blossom reveals her intent—
The spirit of the Cinnabar Field imparts the scripture’s meaning,
the yin spirit of the Cinnabar Field speaking to you.

The perfected one, now arrived, commands the Six Dings—
When the spirit of the Yellow Court arrives, the Six Dings are made to serve.
The *perfected one* refers to the Dao practitioner.
*Spirit’s arrival* means the essence has been attained.
The Six Dings were explained in earlier passages.

Ten recitations, four bows, to pay homage to the Most High—
Bowing to the Most High Lord Lao.
The *Jade Pure True Formula* states: "Those who recite the *Eastern Florescence Jade Scripture*
must perform ten recitations and four bows."
The *Jade Scripture* refers to this text.

First pay respects to the Great Emperor, then face north—
The Great Emperor resides in the east, the Seven Primes dwell in the north.
The *Inner Scripture of the Yellow Court* and the *Jade Book* flow unimpeded—
Through such cultivation and homage, the Dao of the Yellow Court is perfected,
and the principles of the jade scripture become clear.

The one who transmits is called the master; the one who receives takes an oath—
This speaks of the merit of upholding the scripture, which qualifies one to teach others.
This text is worthy of reverence.

Cloud brocade, phoenix gauze, and golden bindings—
These serve as tokens of the oath’s sincerity.
They replace the cutting of hair or flesh—
In ancient times, oaths were sealed by cutting hair and smearing blood,
but now cloud brocade is used to preserve the body whole.

Hand in hand, ascend the mountain to partake of the liquid elixir—
As when transmitting the cinnabar scripture, one swears an oath with blood.
Those who study the divine elixir and golden liquid must first take a solemn vow before receiving instruction.

Only when the golden script and jade luminaries are revealed may they be proclaimed—
Only after the oath is taken may the methods of transcendence be transmitted.
They are imparted to those who hold true faith.

If transmitted to one who receives them with care, like the Three Officials—
The Three Officials are Heaven, Earth, and Water.
Let not the seven ancestors suffer dark misfortune—
To teach the unworthy brings calamity upon the seven generations.
The Most High’s subtle and wondrous path leads to transcendence—
It is most venerable and precious.
This is the scripture of the deathless Dao—
This text holds the way to longevity; receive and practice it with utmost devotion.

*End of the Fifty-Seventh Scroll of the* Ten Books on Cultivating the True: Annotated *Inner Radiance of the Yellow Court*
